senses.de: Far away in distance or time
senses.ex: The remote island can only be reached by boat

Tips.title: Physical Distance
Tips.description: Used to describe places far from population centers or hard to reach.
Tips.example: Her cottage is nestled in a remote part of the highlands.

Tips.title: Temporal Distance
Tips.description: Indicates something from a long time ago, often historical.
Tips.example: They studied the customs of a remote era.

senses.de: Having very little connection with or relationship to
senses.ex: The chance of him getting the job is remote

Tips.title: Likelihood
Tips.description: Suggests a very low chance of something happening.
Tips.example: There's a remote possibility of rain in the desert.

Tips.title: Emotional Detachment
Tips.description: Can be used to describe a lack of emotional connection.
Tips.example: He seemed remote during the party, hardly speaking to anyone.

senses.de: A device that controls an apparatus or machine from a distance
senses.ex: She picked up the remote and changed the channel on the TV

Tips.title: Technical Object
Tips.description: Refers to an electronic gadget for controlling other devices.

Tips.title: Everyday Use
Tips.description: Often used in daily life relating to television or other electronics.
Tips.example: Can you pass me the remote? I want to switch the channel.

senses.de: Operated, done, or triggered by means of radio or infrared signal
senses.ex: The bomb was detonated by remote control

Tips.title: Wireless Technology
Tips.description: Associated with operating something from a distance using technology.
Tips.example: The gates open with a remote sensor.

Tips.title: Automation
Tips.description: Can imply the absence of human operation at the moment of action.
Tips.example: His new car features remote start capability.

senses.de: Far off or retired; unseen; not obvious
senses.ex: The remote corners of the kingdom were the last to be explored

Tips.title: Unexplored Places
Tips.description: Refers to areas that are rarely visited or little-known.
Tips.example: Adventurers set out for the remote regions of the Amazon.

Tips.title: Obscure Reference
Tips.description: Used when something is not immediately recognizable or known.
Tips.example: She made a remote reference to an old folk song.

senses.de: Not easily approached, accessed, or used
senses.ex: The location is remote, but beautiful

Tips.title: Limited Access
Tips.description: Highlights the difficulty of reaching a certain location.
Tips.example: The ancient ruins are in a remote jungle inaccessible by car.

Tips.title: Exclusivity
Tips.description: Sometimes implies a place is special due to its isolation.
Tips.example: We enjoyed our stay at a remote private beach.

Approachable.wordDefinition:
Approachable means friendly and easy to talk to, while the word remote means distant and unapproachable. Approachable is applicable when describing a person who is easy to approach and talk to, while remote is applicable when describing something or someone who is distant and difficult to reach or communicate with.

For example, a teacher who is open to questions and approachable is easy to talk to, while a boss who is aloof and remote is difficult to talk to or approach.

Distant.wordDefinition:
Distant generally refers to something that is far away in physical space, or refers to a relationship between people, places or things that is not close or intimate.

For example, 'I have a distant relative who lives on the other side of the world.'

Overall, both words describe things that are far away, but distant generally refers to physical or social distance while remote is more often used to convey a feeling of seclusion or difficulty in getting there.

Faraway.wordDefinition:
Faraway refers to a location that is physically distant from where you are right now. For example, if you are in New York and you think of Australia as being faraway because it is on the other side of the world.

Faraway refers to physical distance, while remote refers to accessibility and proximity to civilization.

Inaccessible.wordDefinition:
Inaccessible means something cannot be reached or accessed easily. For example, a high-security government facility can be described as inaccessible because it is difficult to enter or access without clearance.

Both words can describe places or objects that are difficult to reach or far away, but inaccessible refers more to the difficulty of access while remote refers more to the distance away.

Isolate.wordDefinition:
Isolate means to separate or keep something or someone apart from others. For example, if someone is diagnosed with a contagious disease, they may need to be isolated in a hospital room so they don't spread the disease to other people.

In general, isolating someone or something is a deliberate action to keep them away from others for safety or privacy reasons.

Off the beaten track.wordDefinition:
The phrase off the beaten track means a place that is not commonly visited or well-known. It could be a hidden gem that is not frequently visited by tourists.

Off the beaten track describes a less-known location that is not commonly visited, while remote describes a location that is far away and difficult to access.

Outlying.wordDefinition:
Outlying refers to something that is located at the edge or fringes of a certain area or region. It suggests that the place is still connected to the main area, but is on the outskirts.

For example, an outlying village is a settlement on the edge of a town or city.

Outlying suggests a location on the fringes, while remote suggests a location that is far and difficult to reach.

Remove.wordDefinition:
Remove means to take something away from a particular place or position. For example, you remove your shoes before entering someone's home or you can remove a stain from clothes by washing them.

Remote refers to distance, while remove refers to taking something away.

Secluded.wordDefinition:
Secluded refers to a place that is hidden or protected from view or outside influences. For example, a secluded beach might be hard to access or hidden from the main tourist areas.

Remote refers to distance and isolation, while secluded refers to privacy and seclusion.

What about claims of superfoods, cleanses, and other body-boosting solutions? Marketing emphasizes the allure of products associated with ancient and remote cultures

quotes.Text: If you run a global business, it's so important that you understand what happens in each place, and you can't do that remotely. I don't want to go anywhere and leave and not have seen the people who work for us. That doesn't feel good.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Gillian Tans

quotes.Text: It is hard to think of practical applications of the black hole. Because practical applications are so remote, many people assume we should not be interested. But this quest to understand the world is what defines us as human beings.
quotes.Title: Russian Businessman
quotes.Name: Yuri Milner

quotes.Text: I loved to read and to write, but then something happened. As I made my way through school, I kept getting handed books to read that didn't excite me and didn't even remotely connect to the realities of my life.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: R. A. Salvatore

quotes.Text: Success in life is founded upon attention to the small things rather than to the large things; to the every day things nearest to us rather than to the things that are remote and uncommon.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Booker T. Washington

quotes.Text: I used to have this illusion that time and remote areas prepare you for the world. Our moms used to think that kind of thing. Well, it doesn't prepare you for the world at all!
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Jim Harrison

quotes.Text: I do not believe, even remotely, that you have to have a partner in your life in order to be whole, in order to be complete, in order to be fulfilled. You just don't have to.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Phil McGraw

quotes.Text: What interests me in writing a novel is taking really remote voices, characters, and stories and beginning to create some kind of web.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Nicole Krauss

quotes.Text: I never thought people would be remotely interested in my silly little life, but I'm really glad that they are.
quotes.Title: Irish Actor
quotes.Name: Kristian Nairn

quotes.Text: It's just fantastic to go out and meet people in the world and get to really remote places.
quotes.Title: Scottish Actor
quotes.Name: Ewan McGregor

quotes.Text: Helping others is the key duty for everyone on this earth who is remotely capable to do so.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Joanna Krupa
